data.title: Databases A - Z
data.text:
Art and Architecture ePortal This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) A&AePortal, Art & Architecture, A and A ePortal, art history, architectural history

The Art & Architecture ePortal database is an eBook resource that features works of scholarship in the history of art, architecture, decorative arts, photography, and design. The database also allows users to search for images within all titles by keyword.

Please contact lib-edatabases@nyu.edu if you encounter the message "Content not available in your region".

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://www.aaeportal.com/

Asian Life in America This link opens in a new window

New

Asian Life in America aggregates coverage from American and global newspapers on the Asian American experience from 2018 to the present. The database provides full-text search and access to content by topic, event, and eras.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://infoweb.newsbank.com/apps/news/easy-search?p=ALIAX

BHC Collective Bibliography This link opens in a new window

New

The Business History Conference is a scholarly organization devoted to encouraging all aspects of research, writing, and teaching about business history and about the environment in which businesses operate. Founded in 1954, the organization is now international in scope, with approximately 30 percent of its membership residing outside North America.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_NO | https://thebhc.org/bibliography/4505918

Chernobyl: Newspapers Collection This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) DA-ChNC

The Chernobyl: Newspapers Collection contains local newspapers in Ukrainian and Russian from the exclusion zone and its immediate vicinity, providing information for the study of the social background and history of the Chernobyl disaster.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://dlib.eastview.com/browse/udb/4190

Dewey Data This link opens in a new window

Alternate Name(s) Dewey.io

Dewey is an academic research data platform that provides access to third-party quantitative and geospatial datasets across a variety of categories including behavioral economics, corporate finance, marketing, public policy, real estate, urban planning, weather, workforce management. Feature datasets include SafeGraph, Advan Research, dataplor. A full list of the data products available at NYU can be found at Dewey Data Available at NYU .

Dewey’s platform allows any user to create an account to view summaries of the data available and download samples. To access NYU’s subscription data, register at https://app.deweydata.io/ using your NYU email (NetID@nyu.edu). A Dewey administrator will upgrade your account with the NYU subscription and send you an email notification to alert you of the change to your account. Upgrades may take up to 48 hours.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://guides.nyu.edu/dewey-data

EdWeek Market Brief This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) Ed week, edweek, ed week, market brief

EdWeek Market Brief provides actionable intelligence about the marketplace of K-12 education through original reporting, deep analysis, and proprietary, data-driven research. It includes insights on: school district purchasing needs, processes, and plans; trends in sales, marketing, and product development among peer organizations; and analysis of large trends and the impact of state and federal funding on businesses.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://marketbrief.edweek.org

Elgaronline This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) Elgar

Elgaronline is a database that provides multi-disciplinary, full-text coverage of a wide array of subject areas such as business, finance, law, environment, public policy, and education. Users also have access to a variety of content types including online books, research reviews, reference & dictionaries, handbooks, and journals.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://www.elgaronline.com/browse

Fanyun Literature (繙云文献) This link opens in a new window

New

Fanyun Literature (繙云文献) contains a collection of Chinese newspapers with coverage spanning 1902-1949. The following titles are included:

The Republican Daily (民国日报) - 1916-1949

Ta Kung Pao (大公报) - 1902-1949

The Central Daily News (中央日报) - 1928-1949

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://fanyun.dhcdb.com.tw/

Global Elections Archive This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) EB-ELECT

The Global Elections Archive contains election ephemera and campaign materials on presidential and parliamentary elections from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Armenia, and other countries of the former USSR such as party programs, propaganda material, special editions of newspapers and literature produced by political parties or candidates with the aim of shaping the election narrative.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://dlib.eastview.com/browse/udb/4570

GrantForward This link opens in a new window

Alternate Name(s) Grant Forward, grant forward

A research funding opportunity database that includes the ability to search for pre-solicitations, grants, awards, sponsors, and researchers. Includes extensive, researcher-focused support materials and an intelligent grant recommendation engine.

Users must create an account with their @nyu.edu email address.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://www.grantforward.com/index

Lived Places Publishing This link opens in a new window

Trial

Alternate Name(s) Lived Places, LPP

Lived Places Publishing is committed to delivering curriculum-ready content that allows students to engage with global author voices exploring the intersection of social identity and place or context. Content includes affordable course readings, library-friendly access, and giving voice to social identity in context and place.

** This database is currently in a trial period. Please send feedback about this database to jill.conte@nyu.edu **

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://livedplacespublishing.com/institutions/new-york-university

Oxford Academic This link opens in a new window

New

Oxford Academic, Oxford University Press (OUP)’s platform for research, offers a single point of entry for access to scholarly and academic books and journals. They serve the diverse and changing research needs of students, researchers, professors, and practitioners and seek ongoing feedback from these communities.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://academic.oup.com/

Social Movements and Political Events This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) EB-SOC

The Social Movements and Political Events collection contains documents, leaflets, flyers, posters and photos from public unrest, demonstrations, mass rallies and other political events in Russia, Armenia, Ukraine, and other countries of the former USSR.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://dlib.eastview.com/browse/udb/4810

The Chernobyl Collection: Documents and Maps This link opens in a new window

New

The Chernobyl Collection: Documents and Maps contains maps of the area near the city of Pripyat and reports prepared for and by Soviet and Ukrainian government agencies detailing the developments in the wake of the Chernobyl disaster. The collection includes internal reports and investigations on the various causes, correspondences between officials in the region, and reports on the development of the power plant.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://dlib.eastview.com/browse/books/5090

The Work from Cannes Lions This link opens in a new window

New

The Work provides access to curated collections of creative campaigns from leading brands and agencies.

Users must sign up to create a personal account using their NYU email address in order to access this resource.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://www.lovethework.com/en-GB/home

Women and Social Movements Library This link opens in a new window

New

Alternate Name(s) WASM, WSM, ASP, WSML, WSMDGS, ASP, Alexander Street Press

The Women and Social Movements Library brings together four databases: Women and Social Movements in the United States (1600-2000), Women and Social Movements, International (1840 to Present), Women and Social Movements in Modern Empires Since 1820, and Women and Social Movements: Development and the Global South (1919-2019). This content comprises more than 13,500 documents containing some 400,000 pages. Database users can track women activists globally and trace particular themes in national, international, or transnational contexts. Cross-cultural comparisons and comparisons across time become much richer when accessing such a large array of primary documents and secondary essays.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://search.alexanderstreet.com/women-social-movements

CINAHL Complete This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) Cumulative Index to Nursing and Allied Health Literature,Cumulative Index to Nursing and Allied Heal

CINAHL indexes over 3,800 journals from the fields of nursing and allied health, with indexing for selected journals back to 1937. Topics covered are related to nursing, physical therapy, health education, social service/healthcare, occupational therapy, and related disciplines. CINAHL also provides access to healthcare books, nursing dissertations, selected conference proceedings, standards of professional practice, educational software and audiovisual materials in nursing. Dates of coverage: 1937 to present.

ONLY KARMS | NYU00202 | PROXY_YES | https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?authtype=ip,uid&custid=s8884376&groupid=main&profile=ehost&defaultdb=ccm

Create your free New York Times Account This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) NYT, the new york times

Current NYU students, faculty, and staff can activate complimentary access to The New York Times digital news content using their NYU email address. After using this link to create an account, NYU users should access NYTimes content by directly logging into the NYTimes site. This complimentary access includes New York Times audio, but excludes NYTimes cooking and puzzles.

Please disconnect from any VPNs and open an incognito or private browser to create a NYTimes account. For additional help and troubleshooting, see our step-by-step sign up instructions.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_NO | https://www.nytimes.com/activate-access/edu-access

Create your free Wall Street Journal account This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) WSJ, the wall street journal

Current NYU students, faculty, and staff can activate complimentary access to The Wall Street Journal digital news content using their NYU email address. After using this link to create an account, NYU users can access Wall Street Journal content by directly logging into the WSJ site.

For additional help and troubleshooting, see our step-by-step sign up instructions.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_NO | https://partner.wsj.com/partner/newyorkuniversity

Ebook Central This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) e-brary,e brary,ebookcentral,e book central,ebook central,ebrary

Ebook Central is NYU's preferred ebook provider. Users can search, read, highlight, and annotate full-text books in many subject areas, including the social sciences and humanities.

ONLY KARMS | NYU00541 | PROXY_NO | https://ebookcentral.proquest.com/lib/nyulibrary-ebooks/home.action

EBSCO Discovery Service This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) combined article & ebook search

EBSCO Discovery Service (EDS) encompasses articles in databases across many disciplines. Users can locate peer reviewed articles, videos, audio files, images, and more from a range of subjects.

Full download of DRM-protected ebooks requires EBSCO account registration and Adobe Digital Editions.

ONLY KARMS | NYU04564 | PROXY_YES | http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?authtype=ip,uid&group=main&profile=eds

HBS Select Case Study Collection This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) harvard, Harvard Business, HBS, Harvard Business School

Harvard Business School case studies provide immersive real-world scenarios and commentary to help students examine issues related to the dynamics of business.

ONLY KARMS | NULL | PROXY_YES | https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?authtype=ip,uid&custid=s8884376&groupid=main&profile=ehost&defaultdb=t098sww

JSTOR This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) Arts & Sciences I VII II III IV V Public Health Reports Life Sciences Ireland

JSTOR provides access to scholarly journals, primarily in the humanities and social sciences. In addition to journal articles, users can access book chapters, ebooks, and primary source documents.

ONLY KARMS | NYU01695 | PROXY_YES | https://www.jstor.org/action/showBasicSearch

Medline via Ovid This link opens in a new window

Featured

The MEDLINE database is widely recognized as the premier source for bibliographic and abstract coverage of biomedical literature. MEDLINE encompasses information from Index Medicus, Index to Dental Literature, and International Nursing, as well as other sources of coverage in the areas of allied health, biological and physical sciences, humanities and information science as they relate to medicine and health care, communication disorders, population biology, and reproductive biology.

ONLY KARMS | NYU00117 | PROXY_YES | http://ovidsp.ovid.com/ovidweb.cgi?T=JS&MODE=ovid&NEWS=N&PAGE=main&D=pmez

Medline via PubMed This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) PubMed, ncbi, pub med

PubMed comprises over 30 million citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. PubMed citations and abstracts include the fields of biomedicine and health, covering portions of the life sciences, behavioral sciences, chemical sciences, and bioengineering. PubMed also provides access to additional relevant web sites and links to the other NCBI molecular biology resources.

ONLY KARMS | NYU00068 | PROXY_NO | https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?myncbishare=nyulibs

MLA International Bibliography (MLAIB) This link opens in a new window

Alternate Name(s) Modern Language Association International Bibliography

The MLA International Bibliography provides bibliographic records for books, book chapters, journal articles, and dissertations published in the fields of modern languages, literatures, folklore, and linguistics. Full text is available for some articles. The MLAIB covers items published from around 1920 to the present.

ONLY KARMS | NYU00681 | PROXY_YES | https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?authtype=ip,uid&custid=s8884376&groupid=main&profile=ehost&defaultdb=mzh

Nineteenth-Century American Drama: Popular Culture and Entertainment, 1820-1900 This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) Mar2018New

Nineteenth-Century American Drama: Popular Culture and Entertainment, 1820-1900 includes a wide variety of works such as historical plays, melodramas, political satires, minstrel shows, comic operas, musical extravaganzas, parlor entertainments, adaptations of novels, and many others.

ONLY KARMS | NYU06425 | PROXY_YES | https://infoweb.newsbank.com/apps/readex?p=AMDRA19C

ProQuest Central This link opens in a new window

Featured

ProQuest Central is a large, multidisciplinary database with over 11,000 titles, with over 8,000 titles in full-text. It serves as the central resource for researchers at all levels in all markets. Over 160 subjects areas are covered extensively in this product including business and economics, health and medical, news and world affairs, technology, social sciences and more.

ONLY KARMS | NYU02080 | PROXY_YES | https://www.proquest.com/advanced

RefWorks This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) Ref Works, Reference Works,

RefWorks is a web-based program for organizing research. Users can save citations, import references retrieved from online bibliographic databases, and create bibliographies in a variety of formats. RefWorks bibliographies are stored on the RefWorks server and are available from any computer with Internet access. For more information see the NYU Libraries Guide

ONLY KARMS | NYU02490 | PROXY_YES | https://refworks.proquest.com/

Skillsoft Books (formerly Books24x7) This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) Books 24 x 7, Books Twenty-four by Seven, Books 24x7

Skillsoft Books (formerly Books24x7) is an online collection of computer technology-related ebooks. It contains hundreds of books and videos from respected IT publishers such as MIT Press, Microsoft Press, Osborne/McGraw-Hill, Que, Sams, Sybex and Wiley. Use it to search for a wide variety of books and videos, ranging from beginners level to advanced (Microsoft Word for beginners or an advanced programming language).

ONLY KARMS | NYU00372 | PROXY_NO | http://proxy.library.nyu.edu/sso/skillport

Web of Science Core Collection This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) WOS, Thomson Reuters

Web of Science Core Collection is a multidisciplinary citation index that includes scholarly articles, conference proceedings, and books in the biomedical, psychosocial, and arts and humanities. The collections contain Science Citation, Social Sciences Citation Index, Arts and Humanities Citation Index , Conference Proceedings Citation Index, Book Citation Index, Emerging Sources Citation Index and Current Chemical Reactions index.

ONLY KARMS | NYU00731 | PROXY_YES | http://webofknowledge.com/wos
